title: Emergency room wait times: Readers recount 10- to 30-hour ER stays
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts residents report emergency room waits from minutes to as long as 30 hours.
State data shows 9.9% of ER visits last 12 hours or more as of 2024.
Healthcare leaders cite staffing shortages and high patient acuity for prolonged ER wait times.

title: 14-year-old arrested after man kicked into moving train at Back Bay
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 14-year-old boy was arrested for allegedly kicking a man into a moving Orange Line train at Back Bay Station.
The attack occurred Tuesday around 7 p.m., resulting in the victim suffering a forehead injury but remaining conscious.
The teen faces assault and battery charges with a dangerous weapon as police continue their investigation.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge on recent Greater Boston news stories.
Peter Chianca, general assignment editor of Boston.com since 2019, oversees the quiz.
The quiz aims to keep readers informed about trending topics in the Greater Boston area.

title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Hearth & Hug Bakery in Somerville launched 'Bye Bridget' merchandise after online criticism for donating sales to a food bank.
Owner Natalie Hug created the line of merch to counteract negativity and will donate proceeds to charity.
The bakery supports various causes, continuing its mission to donate a portion of sales to nonprofit organizations.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gerard 'Jerry' Boucher, 72, and Kathleen 'Kit' Boucher, 71, died after falling through ice at Bee's River in Eastham.
Katy Boucher, their daughter, memorialized them on Facebook, encouraging acts of kindness in their honor.
The Bouchers were Eastham residents since 2008, known for their community involvement and charitable activities.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Authorities are investigating three fires in Fitchburg as arson, occurring within days of each other, according to officials.
Two fires began on Feb. 14 and 15 at a large apartment building on Blossom and Day Streets in Fitchburg.
A third fire on Feb. 18 displaced seven people on Myrtle Avenue, with officials not linking it to the other fires.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria,' died at 53 from ALS, announced less than a year ago.
Dane was a dedicated ALS awareness advocate, receiving the ALS Network's advocate of the year award in 2025.
He is survived by his wife, Rebecca Gayheart, and their daughters, Billie and Georgia. A memoir is set for release in 2026.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police troopers charged with manslaughter in 2024 recruit death have been suspended with pay.
Enrique Delgado-Garcia, 25, died from blunt-force head injuries after a training exercise; troopers accused of causing serious injury.
Lt. Jennifer Penton also faces perjury charges for allegedly lying about when she learned of Delgado-Garcia's symptoms.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police warn of a planned 'takeover' Friday at South Shore Plaza, emphasizing public safety concerns.
The 'takeover' follows previous Massachusetts incidents involving large crowds and vehicle stunts, impacting several communities.
Officers plan to coordinate with law enforcement partners and monitor developments to prepare for potential disruptions.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins predicts Celtics as a dark horse for the 2026 NBA title if Jayson Tatum returns.
Despite losing key players, Celtics rank second in Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record this season.
Perkins highlights Jaylen Brown as an MVP contender for his top-five scoring and defensive stats.
